intro: Achyronia angustissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf achyronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Achyronia angustissima is often found in moist, open habitats such as swamps and wet meadows.
